required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessing Efficacy of Intravenous Acetaminophen vs. Fentanyl for Perioperative Pain Control During Oocyte Retrievals
clinical_study.official_title: Assessing Efficacy of Intravenous Acetaminophen vs. Fentanyl for Perioperative Pain Control During Oocyte Retrievals

brief_summary.textblock: This research study is being done to compare how effective certain medications are at reducing pain after oocyte (egg) retrieval surgery and how effective they are at reducing the time between the retrieval and discharge from the hospital. The investigators will compare intravenous (IV) acetaminophen (Tylenol) to oral (PO) acetaminophen with IV fentanyl and to IV fentanyl only. The investigators also want to find out whether IV acetaminophen can reduce a person's need for opioid pain medications (such as morphine) to "rescue" breakthrough pain.

detailed_description.textblock:
OBJECTIVE: To compare time to discharge from PACU and pain scores between patients who receive IV acetaminophen, PO acetaminophen and IV fentanyl, or IV fentanyl alone for pain control while undergoing oocyte retrievals.
HYPOTHESIS: The investigators' hypothesis is that patients receiving IV acetaminophen will have improved or equivalent pain scores, require less opiate medication, and have shorter time to discharge from PACU than those receiving PO acetaminophen and IV fentanyl or IV fentanyl alone.
Participants will be enrolled for the study one to two days before their oocyte retrieval. If and when informed consent is obtained, the patient will be randomized to one of three treatments.
Groups will receive medications as follows:
Group 1: In the PACU, 30 minutes before the planned start of the procedure, will receive IV 1 gram acetaminophen and PO placebo; followed by standard propofol for conscious sedation Group 2: In the PACU, 30 minutes before the planned start of the procedure, will receive PO 1 gram acetaminophen and IV placebo, followed by IV fentanyl and standard propofol for conscious sedation Group 3: In the PACU, 30 minutes before the planned start of the procedure, will receive the current standard of care of IV placebo and PO placebo, followed by IV fentanyl and standard propofol for conscious sedation
The participant group will be blinded to the reproductive endocrinologist, RN, study staff, and patient. The anesthesiologist will NOT be blinded to the study group.
A member of the investigators study staff will review participants' medical record to collect data regarding demographic, non identifying information, as well as cycle and pregnancy outcomes. This will occur at three instances, occurring at one month, three months, and one year after the participants' procedure

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: To compare time to discharge from PACU and pain scores between patients who receive IV acetaminophen, PO acetaminophen and IV fentanyl, or IV fentanyl alone for pain control while undergoing oocyte retrievals, measured in minutes.
To compare Pain scores (Using Numeric Pain Intensity/Wong-Baker FACES Pain Rating Scale) measured every 10 minutes until discharge from the PACU

secondary_outcome.description: Time to rescue analgesia (measured in minutes)

secondary_outcome.measure: Total amount of PO opiates consumed within 6 hours postoperatively for adequate analgesia
secondary_outcome.description: Total amount of PO opiates consumed within 6 hours postoperatively for adequate analgesia (total measured in milligrams)
Total operative time (as calculated in minutes from start/stop times)

secondary_outcome.measure: Medications and dosages used while in the PACU
secondary_outcome.description: Medications and dosages used while in the PACU as given by PACU RN
Postoperative nausea and vomiting (until discharge from the PACU) (measured as dichotomous variables for yes/no: reported nausea and reported emesis)

secondary_outcome.measure: Amount of pain medication used at home
secondary_outcome.description: Amount of pain medication used at home (measured as total dose in 24 hr period post-op reported by patients of follow up phone call)
Oocyte yield (total # oocytes and total # mature oocytes)
Implantation rate (# gestational sacs/# embryos transferred)
Pregnancy rate (defined as FCA on US)
Live birth rate (Defined as live birth > 24 wks gestation)

arm_group.description: In the PACU, 30 minutes before the planned start of the procedure, will receive IV 1 gram acetaminophen and PO placebo; followed by standard propofol for conscious sedation
In the PACU, 30 minutes before the planned start of the procedure, will receive PO 1 gram acetaminophen and IV placebo, followed by IV fentanyl and standard propofol for conscious sedation

In the PACU, 30 minutes before the planned start of the procedure, will receive the current standard of care of IV placebo and PO placebo, followed by IV fentanyl and standard propofol for conscious sedation

intervention.description: IV Acetaminophen for pain control during procedure
PO Acetaminophen for pain control during procedure
IV Fentanyl for pain control during procedure

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing oocyte retrievals
Exclusion Criteria:
- Chronic opiate users
- Liver disease patients
- Allergy/hypersensitivity to acetaminophen
- Patients weighing less than 50kg, history of alcohol dependence, renal impairment, and opiate allergy
- Patients that have used acetaminophen during the 24 hours before their scheduled surgery
- Oocyte donors
- History of chronic pain or opioid dependence
- History of phenylketonuria (PKU)

responsible_party.investigator_title: Chief, Division of Reproductive Medicine and IVF, Principal Investigator, Clinical Professor
